db:abstract.db:para: The QTextToSpeech class provides a convenient access to text-to-speech engines.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Use say() to start reading text to the default audio device, and stop(), pause(), and resume() to control the reading of the text.
To synthesize text into PCM data for further processing, use synthesize().

Use findVoices() to get a list of matching voices, or use availableVoices() to get the list of voices that support the current locale. Change the locale property, using one of the availableLocales() that is a good match for the language that the input text is in, and for the accent of the desired voice output. This will change the list of available voices on most platforms. Then use one of the available voices in a call to setVoice().
Not every engine supports all features. Use the engineCapabilities() function to test which features are available, and adjust the usage of the class accordingly.

db:note.db:para: Which locales and voices the engine supports depends usually on the Operating System configuration. E.g. on macOS, end users can install voices through the Accessibility panel in System Preferences.

db:section.db:title: enum QTextToSpeech::BoundaryHint
db:section.db:para: describes when speech should be stopped and paused.

db:td.db:para: Uses the engine specific default behavior.
The engine should stop playback immediately.
Stop speech when the current word is finished.
Stop speech when the current sentence is finished.
Stop speech when the current utterance is finished. An utterance is the block of text used in a call to say() or enqueue().

db:note.db:para: These are hints to the engine. The current engine might not support all options.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] enum QTextToSpeech::Capability
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the capabilities of a text-to-speech engine.

db:td.db:para: The engine implements none of the capabilities.
The engine can play audio output from text.
The engine can pause and then resume the audo output.
The engine emits the sayingWord() signal for each word that gets spoken.
The engine can synthesize PCM audio data from text.

db:section.db:para: This enum was introduced or modified in Qt 6.6.
The Capabilities type is a typedef for QFlags<Capability>. It stores an OR combination of Capability values.

db:section.db:title: enum QTextToSpeech::ErrorReason
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the current error, if any, of the QTextToSpeech engine.

db:td.db:para: No error has occurred.
The backend could not be initialized, e.g. due to a missing driver or operating system requirement.
The given backend configuration is inconsistent, e.g. due to wrong voice name or parameters.
The given text could not be synthesized, e.g. due to invalid size or characters.
Audio playback failed e.g. due to missing audio device, wrong format or audio streaming interruption.

db:section.db:para: Use errorReason() to obtain the current error and errorString() to get the related error message.

db:section.db:title: enum QTextToSpeech::State
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the current state of the text-to-speech engine.

db:td.db:para: The synthesizer is ready to start a new text. This is also the state after a text was finished.
Text is being spoken.
Text is being synthesized into PCM data. The synthesized() signal will be emitted with chunks of data.
The synthesis was paused and can be resumed with resume().
An error has occurred. Details are given by errorReason().

db:section.db:title: [since 6.4] engine : QString
db:section.db:para: This property holds the engine used to synthesize text to speech.
Changing the engine stops any ongoing speech.
On most platforms, changing the engine will update the list of available locales and available voices.
This property was introduced in Qt 6.4.

db:listitem.db:para: bool setEngine(const QString &engine, const QVariantMap &params = QVariantMap())

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since 6.6] engineCapabilities : const Capabilities
db:section.db:para: This property holds the capabilities implemented by the current engine
This property was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: locale : QLocale
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current locale in use.
By default, the system locale is used.
On some platforms, changing the locale will update the list of available voices, and if the current voice is not available with the new locale, a new voice will be set.

db:section.db:title: pitch : double
db:section.db:para: This property holds the voice pitch, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0.
The default of 0.0 is the normal speech pitch.

db:section.db:title: rate : double
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current voice rate, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0.
The default value of 0.0 is normal speech flow.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] state : const State
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current state of the speech synthesizer.
Use say() to start synthesizing text with the current voice and locale.

db:section.db:title: voice : QVoice
db:section.db:para: This property holds the voice that will be used for the speech.
The voice needs to be one of the voices available for the engine.
On some platforms, setting the voice changes other voice attributes such as locale, pitch, and so on. These changes trigger the emission of signals.

db:section.db:title: volume : double
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current volume, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0.
The default value is the platform's default volume.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] void QTextToSpeech::synthesize(const QString &text, Functor &&functor)
db:section.db:bridgehead: [since 6.6] void QTextToSpeech::synthesize(const QString &text, const QObject *context, Functor &&functor)
db:section.db:para: Synthesizes the text into raw audio data.

This function synthesizes the speech asynchronously into raw audio data. When data is available, the functor will be called as functor(QAudioFormat format, QByteArray bytes), with format describing the format of the data in bytes; or as functor(QAudioBuffer &buffer).

The state property is set to Synthesizing when the synthesis starts, and to Ready once the synthesis is finished. While synthesizing, the functor might be called multiple times, possibly with changing values for format.
The functor can be a callable, like a lambda or free function, with an optional context object:
or a member function of the context object:
If context is destroyed, then the functor will no longer get called.

db:note.db:para: This API requires that the engine has the Synthesize capability.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextToSpeech::QTextToSpeech(QObject *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Loads a text-to-speech engine from a plug-in that uses the default engine plug-in and constructs a QTextToSpeech object as the child of parent.
The default engine is platform-specific.

If the engine initializes correctly, then the state of the engine will change to QTextToSpeech::Ready; note that this might happen asynchronously. If the plugin fails to load, then state will be set to QTextToSpeech::Error.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextToSpeech::QTextToSpeech(const QString &engine, QObject *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Loads a text-to-speech engine from a plug-in that matches parameter engine and constructs a QTextToSpeech object as the child of parent.
If engine is empty, the default engine plug-in is used. The default engine is platform-specific.

If the engine initializes correctly, the state of the engine will be set to QTextToSpeech::Ready. If the plugin fails to load, or if the engine fails to initialize, the engine's state will be set to QTextToSpeech::Error.

db:section.db:title: [explicit, since 6.4] QTextToSpeech::QTextToSpeech(const QString &engine, const QVariantMap &params, QObject *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Loads a text-to-speech engine from a plug-in that matches parameter engine and constructs a QTextToSpeech object as the child of parent, passing params through to the engine.

If engine is empty, the default engine plug-in is used. The default engine is platform-specific. Which key/value pairs in params are supported depends on the engine. See the engine documentation for details. Unsupported entries will be ignored.

If the engine initializes correctly, the state of the engine will be set to QTextToSpeech::Ready. If the plugin fails to load, or if the engine fails to initialize, the engine's state will be set to QTextToSpeech::Error.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.4.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QTextToSpeech::~QTextToSpeech()
db:section.db:para: Destroys this QTextToSpeech object, stopping any speech.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] void QTextToSpeech::aboutToSynthesize(qsizetype id)
db:section.db:para: This signal gets emitted just before the engine starts to synthesize the speech audio for id. The id is the value returned by a call to enqueue(), Applications can use this signal to make last-minute changes to voice attributes, or to track the process of text enqueued via enqueue().
This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: [static] QStringList QTextToSpeech::availableEngines()
db:section.db:para: Gets the list of supported text-to-speech engine plug-ins.

db:section.db:title: QList<QLocale> QTextToSpeech::availableLocales() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the list of locales that are supported by the active engine.

db:section.db:title: QList<QVoice> QTextToSpeech::availableVoices() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the list of voices available for the current locale.

db:note.db:para: If no locale has been set, the system locale is used.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] qsizetype QTextToSpeech::enqueue(const QString &utterance)
db:section.db:para: Adds utterance to the queue of texts to be spoken, and starts speaking. Returns the index of the text in the queue, or -1 in case of an error.
If the engine's state is currently Ready, utterance will be spoken immediately. Otherwise, the engine will start to speak utterance once it has finished speaking the current text.

Each time the engine proceeds to the next text entry in the queue, the aboutToSynthesize() signal gets emitted. This allows applications to keep track of the progress, and to make last-minute changes to voice attributes.
Calling stop() clears the queue. To pause the engine at the end of a text, use the Utterance boundary hint.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: void QTextToSpeech::errorOccurred(QTextToSpeech::ErrorReason reason, const QString &errorString)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted after an error occurred and the state has been set to QTextToSpeech::Error. The reason parameter specifies the type of error, and the errorString provides a human-readable error description.
QTextToSpeech::ErrorReason is not a registered metatype, so for queued connections, you will have to register it with Q_DECLARE_METATYPE() and qRegisterMetaType().

db:section.db:title: QTextToSpeech::ErrorReason QTextToSpeech::errorReason() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the reason why the engine has reported an error.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextToSpeech::errorString() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current engine error message.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] QList<QVoice> QTextToSpeech::findVoices(Args &&... args) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the list of voices that match the criteria in args.

The arguments in args are processed in order to assemble the list of voices that match all of them. An argument of type QString is matched against the name, of the voice, an argument of type QLocale is matched agains the voice's locale, etc. It is possible to specify only the Language or Territory of the desired voices, and the name can be matched against a regular expression.
This function returns all voices if the list of criteria is empty. Multiple criteria of the same type are not possible and will result in a compile-time error.

db:note.db:para: Unless args includes the current locale, this function might need to change the locale of the engine to get the list of all voices. This is engine specific, but might impact ongoing speech synthesis. It is therefore advisable to not call this function unless the state is Ready.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: void QTextToSpeech::pause(QTextToSpeech::BoundaryHint boundaryHint = QTextToSpeech::BoundaryHint::Default)
db:section.db:para: Pauses the current speech at boundaryHint.
Whether the boundaryHint is respected depends on the engine.

db:section.db:title: void QTextToSpeech::resume()
db:section.db:para: Resume speaking after pause() has been called.

db:note.db:para: On Android, resuming paused speech will restart from the beginning. This is a limitation of the underlying text-to-speech engine.

db:section.db:title: void QTextToSpeech::say(const QString &text)
db:section.db:para: Starts speaking the text.
This function starts sythesizing the speech asynchronously, and reads the text to the default audio output device.

db:note.db:para: All in-progress readings are stopped before beginning to read the recently synthesized text.

db:section.db:para: The current state is available using the state property, and is set to Speaking once the reading starts. When the reading is done, state will be set to Ready.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] void QTextToSpeech::sayingWord(const QString &word, qsizetype id, qsizetype start, qsizetype length)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: void sayingWord(const QString &word, qsizetype id, qsizetype start, qsizetype length)

db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the word, which is the slice of text indicated by start and length in the utterance id, gets played to the audio device.

db:note.db:para: This signal requires that the engine has the WordByWordProgress capability.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.4] bool QTextToSpeech::setEngine(const QString &engine, const QVariantMap &params = QVariantMap())
db:section.db:para: Sets the engine used by this QTextToSpeech object to engine, passing params through to the engine constructor.
Returns whether engine could be set successfully.
Which key/value pairs in params are supported depends on the engine. See the engine documentation for details. Unsupported entries will be ignored.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.4.

db:section.db:title: void QTextToSpeech::stop(QTextToSpeech::BoundaryHint boundaryHint = QTextToSpeech::BoundaryHint::Default)
db:section.db:para: Stops the current reading at boundaryHint, and clears the queue of pending texts.
The reading cannot be resumed. Whether the boundaryHint is respected depends on the engine.
